flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: Using a few simple materials that you may already have around the house, you can design and launch your own rocket. 1-2-3 Let's Go!
guide.introduction_rendered:
Using a few simple materials that you may already have around the house, you can design and launch your own rocket. 1-2-3 Let's Go!

Relevant parts
  • Film Canister
  • 8-1/2x11 in. piece of construction paper
  • Baking soda
  • Vinegar
  • Paint or markers (optional)
  • Bottle cap
  • Tape
Tools
  • Scissors

lines.text: Take the top off of a plastic film canister and wrap a sheet of construction paper around it. Tape it in place so that the open end of the canister sticks out at the bottom.
lines.text_raw: Take the top off of a plastic film canister and wrap a sheet of construction paper around it. Tape it in place so that the open end of the canister sticks out at the bottom.

lines.text: Create a nose cone for the rocket by cutting a circle out of construction paper, using scissors to make a cut to the center, and bending it into a cone shape that you can tape to the end of the tube opposite the film canister so it looks like the second picture.
lines.text_raw: Create a nose cone for the rocket by cutting a circle out of construction paper, using scissors to make a cut to the center, and bending it into a cone shape that you can tape to the end of the tube opposite the film canister so it looks like the second picture.

lines.text: Decorate your rocket creatively with paint or markers. If you have extra pieces of construction paper, you can cut them into the shape of fins to attach to the bottom of the rocket.
lines.text_raw: Decorate your rocket creatively with paint or markers. If you have extra pieces of construction paper, you can cut them into the shape of fins to attach to the bottom of the rocket.

lines.text: (I'm not the best artist, but this step isn't required.)
lines.text_raw: (I'm not the best artist, but this step isn't required.)

lines.text: Put some baking soda on the inside of the film canister lid and smooth it out. In my case, I just had to add 1 teaspoon.
lines.text_raw: Put some baking soda on the inside of the film canister lid and smooth it out. In my case, I just had to add 1 teaspoon.

lines.text: Hold your rocket upside down and fill the film canister about halfway or so with vinegar. If you want it to go faster, add more. But beware, don't make the same mistake it did when I added too much vinegar. (It exploded in my hands, ouch!)
lines.text_raw: Hold your rocket upside down and fill the film canister about halfway or so with vinegar. If you want it to go faster, add more. But beware, don't make the same mistake it did when I added too much vinegar. (It exploded in my hands, ouch!)

lines.text: Put the lid with the baking soda on the canister, quickly set the rocket down, and step away. You need to do this very quick.
lines.text_raw: Put the lid with the baking soda on the canister, quickly set the rocket down, and step away. You need to do this very quick.

lines.text: The baking soda and vinegar will react to form carbon dioxide (a gas that has one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms), and the pressure created by the gas will force the lid off the container, launching your rocket into the air and crashing down.
lines.text_raw: The baking soda and vinegar will react to form carbon dioxide (a gas that has one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms), and the pressure created by the gas will force the lid off the container, launching your rocket into the air and crashing down.

lines.text: Please, launch the rocket outdoors to prevent it from hitting someone or his/her property.This thing can shoot pretty high, so be very carefull! Happy making!
lines.text_raw: Please, launch the rocket outdoors to prevent it from hitting someone or his/her property.This thing can shoot pretty high, so be very carefull! Happy making!

lines.text: (As you can see It was icy outside when I made this. I made it in February.)
lines.text_raw: (As you can see It was icy outside when I made this. I made it in February.)

lines.text: Or you don't even need the body, you could just shoot the canister itself.
lines.text_raw: Or you don't even need the body, you could just shoot the canister itself.

guide.summary: A rocket that uses the carbon dioxide principles of vinegar and baking soda.
guide.title: Vinegar and Baking Soda Rocket
